page.title: 14MEDICAL CARE: ACTON/L'HAM
page.content: Facilities under the National Health Service in this rural area are ade- quate. The nearest doctor's surgery is Lavenham. In an emergency there is a home visit day or night. The General Hospital is at Bury. Sudbury has two minor establishments which cater for the elderly, including a day centre for recreation. A clinic deals with minor injuries and an X-RAY Dept. An ambu- lance and car service is available for patients to attend at any hospital. In case of emergency there is a central ambulance station in Sudbury. Most maternity cases are dealt with at Bury Hospital though supervision is carried out by local GP. Attached to the surgery is a Health Visitor, Midwife and District Nurse. A chiropody service is available to retired people with home visits for the housebound.
